verses.verse: Why do the nations <WH1471> rage <WH7283>, And the peoples <WH3816> meditate <WH1897> a vain thing <WH7385>?
The kings <WH4428> of the earth <WH776> set <WH3320> themselves <WH7336>, And the rulers take counsel <WH3245> together <WH3162>, Against Jehovah <WH3068>, and against his anointed <WH4899>, saying,
Let us break <WH5423> their bonds <WH4147> asunder <WH5423>, And cast away <WH7993> their cords from us <WH5688>.
He that sitteth <WH3427> in the heavens <WH8064> will laugh <WH7832>: The Lord <WH136> will have them in derision <WH3932>.
Then will he speak <WH1696> unto them in his wrath <WH639>, And vex <WH926> them in his sore displeasure <WH2740>:
Yet I have set <WH5258> my king <WH4428> Upon my holy <WH6944> hill <WH2022> of Zion <WH6726>.
I will tell <WH5608> of the decree <WH2706>: Jehovah <WH3068> said <WH559> unto me <WH1121>, Thou art my son; This day <WH3117> have I begotten thee <WH3205>.
Ask <WH7592> of me <WH5414>, and I will give thee the nations <WH1471> for thine inheritance <WH5159>, And the uttermost parts <WH657> of the earth <WH776> for thy possession <WH272>.
Thou shalt break <WH7489> them with a rod <WH7626> of iron <WH1270>; Thou shalt dash them in pieces <WH5310> like a potter <WH3335>'s vessel <WH3627>.
Now therefore be wise <WH7919>, O ye kings <WH4428>: Be instructed <WH3256>, ye judges <WH8199> of the earth <WH776>.
Serve <WH5647> Jehovah <WH3068> with fear <WH3374>, And rejoice <WH1523> with trembling <WH7461>.

Kiss <WH5401> the son <WH1248>, lest he be angry <WH599>, and ye perish <WH6> in the way <WH1870>, For his wrath <WH639> will soon be <WH4592> kindled <WH1197>. Blessed <WH835> are all they that take refuge in him <WH2620>.
